data.title: People murdered in Sri Lanka: Lasantha Wickrematunge, Nadarajah Raviraj, Taraki Sivaram, S. W. R. D. Bandaranaike, Sarathambal, Mary Bastian
data.meta_description: People murdered in Sri Lanka: Lasantha Wickrematunge, Nadarajah Raviraj, Taraki Sivaram, S. W. R. D. Bandaranaike, Sarathambal, Mary Bastian by Source: Wikipedia - ISBN 10: 115762121X - ISBN 13: 9781157621218 - Books LLC, Wiki Series - 2011 - Softcover
data.text:
Reseña del editor:

Please note that the content of this book primarily consists of articles available from Wikipedia or other free sources online. Pages: 30. Chapters: Lasantha Wickrematunge, Nadarajah Raviraj, Taraki Sivaram, S. W. R. D. Bandaranaike, Sarathambal, Mary Bastian, Rajini Thiranagama, T. Maheswaran, Thiruchelvam Nihal Jim Brown, Eugene John Hebert, Richard de Zoysa, Selvarajah Rajivarnam, Murugesapillai Koneswary, Mylvaganam Nimalrajan, M. X. Karunaratnam, Ilayathambi Tharsini, Vijaya Kumaranatunga, Joseph Pararajasingham, Krishanti Kumaraswamy, Chandra Fernando, Ida Carmelitta, K. Sivanesan, Kethesh Loganathan, Sinnathamby Sivamaharajah, George Jeyarajasingham, Aiyathurai Nadesan, K. S. Raja, Sathasivam Baskaran, Relangi Selvarajah, Subramaniyam Sugirdharajan, Premawathie Manamperi, Sampath Lakmal de Silva, Mariathas Manojanraj, Lakshman Algama, Ariyanayagam Chandra Nehru, Premini Thanuskodi, Kuruppu Karunaratne, Premakeerthi de Alwis, Chandrabose Suthaharan, P. Devakumaran, Nihal Silva, Vettivelu Yogeswaran, Suresh Kumar and Ranjith Kumar incident, Thevis Guruge, Maheswary Velautham. Excerpt: Lasantha Manilal Wickrematunge (5 April 1958 - 8 January 2009) was a prominent Sri Lankan high-profile anti-government journalist media personality politician and human rights activist who was assassinated on January 2009. The assassination became even more notable because of a chilling editorial he had written in anticipation of being killed, in which he blames the Sri Lanka government for using assassination to stifle the media: "Murder has become the primary tool whereby the state seeks to control the organs of liberty"Wickrematunge was known for taking "governments of all hues to task", was a "virulent critic of the Mahinda Rajapaksa government", and had been "locked in a legal battle with the president's brother, defence secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa", who was seeking a military solution to the Tamil insurgency.
